1.segment: BACKGROUND : Since the outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 ( COVID-19 ) in late 2019 ,

2.segment: it has evolved into a global pandemic that has become a substantial public health concern .

3.segment: COVID-19 is still causing a large number of deaths in several countries around the world because of the lack of effective treatment .

4.segment: AIM : To systematically compare the outcomes of COVID-19 patients treated with integrated Chinese with western ( ICW ) medicine versus western medicine ( WM ) alone by pooling the data of published literature ,

5.segment: and to determine if ICW treatment of COVID-19 patients has better clinical outcomes .

7.segment: Embase , Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) ,

8.segment: China Clinical Trial Registry , Chinese Biomedical Literature Database ( CBM ) ,

9.segment: China National Knowledge Infrastructure ( CNKI ) and Wanfang databases using keywords related to COVID-19 ,

10.segment: traditional Chinese medicine ( TCM ) and treatment effect .

11.segment: The search deadline was until 10 February 2021 .

12.segment: All randomised controlled ( RC ) and non-randomised controlled ( NRC ) clinical trials of the ICW or WM treatment of COVID-19 patients were included .

15.segment: turning negative rate of viral nucleic acid ,

16.segment: remission rate and remission time of symptoms such as fever ,

17.segment: cough , feebleness and chest computed tomography ( CT ) and the number of white blood cells ( WBCs ) and lymphocytes ( LYM ) of the COVID-19 patients .

19.segment: the ratio risk ( RR ) and weighted mean difference ( WMD ) were used as the indexes of the statistical analysis , respectively .

20.segment: RevMan 5.4 was used to perform meta-analyses and forest plots with the fixed-effects and random-effects models .

21.segment: Cochrane risk of bias tool ( RoB 2.0 ) was used to assess the risk of bias in the included RC trials ,

22.segment: whereas risk of bias in non-randomised studies of interventions was used to assess the risk of bias in NRC trials .

23.segment: RESULTS : This research includes 16 studies with 1645 valid confirmed COVID-19 patients ,

24.segment: among which 895 patients of the experimental group received ICW treatment whereas 750 patients of the control group received WM treatment .

25.segment: The outcomes were assessed in three aspects ,

28.segment: respectively , and the results showed that the ICW group had better treatment outcomes compared with the WM. Among the overall indicators ,

29.segment: the ICW group displayed a higher effective rate ( RR = 1.24 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) : 1.16 -- 1.33 ) ,

30.segment: clinical cure rate ( RR = 1.27 , 95 % CI : 1.03 -- 1.56 ) and lower exacerbation rate ( RR = 0.36 , 95 % CI : 0.25 -- 0.52 ) ,

31.segment: but no statistical difference was observed in the turning negative rate of viral nucleic acid ( RR = 1.20 , 95 % CI : 0.78 -- 1.85 ) .

32.segment: Among the symptom indicators , the ICW group had a higher fever remission rate ( RR = 1.24 , 95 % CI : 1.09 -- 1.42 ) ,

33.segment: less fever remission time ( WMD = − 1.49 , 95 % CI : − 1.85 to − 1.12 ) ,

34.segment: a higher cough remission rate ( RR = 1.38 , 95 % CI : 1.10 -- 1.73 ) and a feebleness remission rate ( RR = 1.45 , 95 % CI : 1.18 -- 1.77 ) ,

35.segment: less cough remission time ( WMD = − 1.61 , 95 % CI : − 2.35 to − 0.87 ) and feebleness remission time ( WMD = − 1.50 , 95 % CI : − 2.38 to − 0.61 ) and better improvement in chest CT ( RR = 1.19 , 95 % CI : 1.11 -- 1.28 ) .

36.segment: For blood indicator , the number of WBCs in the blood of patients of ICW group rebounded significantly ( WMD = 0.35 , 95 % CI : 0.16 -- 0.54 ) ,

37.segment: and the recovery of LYM in the blood was more obvious ( WMD = 0.23 , 95 % CI : 0.06 -- 0.40 ) .

38.segment: CONCLUSION : The results of this study show that the outcomes in COVID-19 patients treated by the ICW is better than those treated by the WM treatment alone ,

39.segment: suggesting that WM and TCM can be complementary in the treatment of COVID-19 .
